ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] Player wipe on Test
ygData.msgSnippet: Nope I m not goin back to the Test server without my items and levels back. Sorry, some of the stuff I got is near impossible to get there.  Do you have ANY
ygData.messageBody:
Nope I'm not goin back to the Test server without my items and levels back.
Sorry, some of the stuff I got is near impossible to get there. Do you have
ANY idea how hard it is to get enough folks together to do naggy on test?
Or to do a hate break?

hehe NA GA DA! Not gonna do it!

Bubye Test Server :(

It was already bad enough living in mortal terror of getting a corpse stuck
in a wall. (seriously, no GM's and no high level mages = Lost corpse & all
items) Happened to me twice

Not goin back. Just aint worth the frustration.

----- Original Message -----
From: "Gordon Hughes" <ghughes@...>
To: <eqbards@egroups.com>
Sent: Wednesday, June 21, 2000 9:13 AM
Subject: [eqbards] Player wipe on Test


> Ouch! :(
>
> In case some of you don't know, the entire player-base on the Test server
> was wiped yesterday. Verant's reason being they wanted a clean slate to
> conduct ongoing tests. Fair enough, I suppose - we wipe our test database
> from time to time to clear out all the junk that accumulates - but for
those
> that had characters there, my condolences.
>
> I can only imagine what it must feel like to have built up a character
over
> the last year to have it wiped, and with little or no warning from what
I've
> heard.
>
> Lyrnia, you had a high level Bard on test, didn't you?
>
> I read on the Gameplay board this morning that Brad is taking suggestions
> on:
>
> 1) Reinstating characters but wiping out all their items.
>
> 2) Offering players to move their characters onto the live servers without
> their items.
>
> I can understand their reasons for going ahead with the wipe, but it still
> stinks nonetheless.
>
>
